AD_TieflingGuard8.synopsis: Ikaron either comments on the fact that the goblins have been defeated, or that they tiefligns have already bene attacked.

GruntingKid_Hideout.synopsis: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.

Refugee4.synopsis: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.

PAD_ElevatorUnusable.synopsis: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.

Mule1.synopsis: The ox is waiting in the cave while the tieflings decide whether to return to the road or not. He has been watching the druids in the grove below, and how they can change into any form they wish. He's wistful and sulky, wishing he could change his own shape from an ox to something less subservient.He can give us a hint about an item stashed in his hay.

AD_TieflingGuard11.synopsis: Most of these are for when Zorru, who Lae'zel may have scared absolutely shitless, spots her again.

AD_TieflingGuard3.synopsis: Okta is leaning over her cooking pot, trying to make something edible as she mutters to herself.

GraveDig.synopsis: This occurs in the DEN. The dead can be Kanon, Aradin or Zevlor. It is a recently made grave.

Squirrel.synopsis: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
Squirrel.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 209.06, 26.53, 405.40 and move forward to trigger Attack on Den situation.4. killcombat to resolve it.5. goto 237.55, 31.08, 468.206. Talk with Timber the squirrel

AD_TieflingGuard4.synopsis: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions

TieflingGuard11.synopsis: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.

GruntingKid.synopsis: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts. He will disappear into a hidden hatch in the ground the first time he's encountered. He will return a day later and the player can convince him to reveal the hidden entrance if they're careful.

VB_Grave_Kanon.synopsis: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.synopsis: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.

AD_Gatekeeper.synopsis: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.

AD_Refugee4.synopsis: Waiting for an attack of goblins on the druid grove. On edge.

AD_TieflingGuard5.synopsis: Sprawled on the ground - temporarily paralysed by a potion. Pissed off at herself. Blames her own 'idiocy'.

TieflingGuard10.synopsis: A Tiefling in the druid grove who's keen to banter and joke. She's a bit flirtatious, though there's an undercurrent of fear throughout it all. She's genuinely afraid that she's going to die, and her only coping mechanism is to joke about it - in this case offering to make a bet. She's looking for something to look forward to.RERECORD NOTES: All lines in that dialogue have been set to rerecord with a few line changes. Overall direction. she needs to a more tongue in cheek humorous delivery.

Mule2.synopsis: An ox used by the tiefling refugees to tow their wagons. Currently  grazing in the druid grove, it seems bored and unaffected by the dramas unfolding around it.

Tiefling001.synopsis: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.

AD_Adventurer02.synopsis: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.

RefugeeChef.synopsis: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.synopsis: This occurs between Okta and Ikaron. Okta is the grumpy chef in the camp and Ikaron is her son, a surly but caring guard. The purpose of these is to highlight their relationship, and how both of them care deeply for the camp, even if they're not the best at expressing it.

ElevatorBear.synopsis: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up

AD_CorpseMove.synopsis: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.

PAD_EntranceStatue.synopsis: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.

PAD_ElkStatue.synopsis: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.

AD_GruntingKid.synopsis: General, casual grunt from grunting kid while he's under normal circumstances in the druid grove.

Rat.synopsis: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.

PAD_BearStatue.synopsis: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.

TieflingGuard8.synopsis: A stoic guard. You're a stranger in his camp, and he warns you no to cause trouble. They've already lost a lot of people.

PAD_WolfStatue.synopsis: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.synopsis: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.

Gatekeeper.synopsis: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.

TieflingGuard4.synopsis: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.

TieflingGuard5.synopsis: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.

AD_Refugee1.synopsis: Preparing to go to Baldur's Gate, wondering what to bring.

VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader.synopsis: This is the grave of Aradin, the adventurer leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.

AD_TieflingGuard1.synopsis: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.

reasoning: The session 'GraveDig' refers to a grave that can be for Kanon, Aradin, or Zevlor. Therefore, it is dependent on the presence of these characters' graves, which can be triggered by their deaths. This suggests that the sessions 'VB_Grave_Kanon', 'VB_Grave_TieflingLeader', and 'VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader' should follow the events leading to their respective deaths.

The session 'AD_TieflingGuard5' indicates that the tiefling has been paralyzed by a potion and suggests a connection to the hag mentioned in her dialogue. This implies a potential order where 'AD_TieflingGuard5' must precede any mention of the hag's influence, particularly if her potion is being discussed.
The session 'TieflingGuard5' mentions the hag and her potion that caused paralysis. This connects it to the actions and consequences involving the hag's potions, establishing a causal relationship.

The session 'AD_Refugee4' indicates that the refugees are on edge, waiting for an attack, which logically suggests that this session would come before any attack or confrontation involving the goblins, which could be linked to 'Gatekeeper' and other related sessions.

The session 'AD_Adventurer02' mentions being stuck in a grove full of refugees, which implies that it happens while the refugees are there, so it should come after the setup sessions for the refugee camp.

AD_TieflingGuard8_0.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard8_0.text: Should be safe to travel now.

AD_TieflingGuard8_1.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard8_1.text: No helping it. We're exposed now.

GruntingKid_Hideout_0.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4_0.speaker: Toron
Refugee4_0.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4_0.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

Refugee4_1.speaker: Toron
Refugee4_1.text: This place is a bloody death trap, not a sanctuary. You should clear off while you can.

Refugee4_2.speaker: Toron
Refugee4_2.text: We're cornered in this place. Even the bloody druids look like they might turn on us.

Mule1_3.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_3.text: I have no more to say. Even old hay tastes better than your idle chatter.

Mule1_6.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_6.text: Another one. What are you under there, then? Ant? Aurochs?

Mule1_16.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_16.text: The keepers of this place. They change their form to fit their need.

Mule1_4.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_4.text: They become birds, to hunt on the wing. Bears, to tear flesh with teeth. But for me - only oxen. Only same old hay.

Mule1_26.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_26.text: And I cannot even eat it, because the horned ones hide their shiny bits inside.

Mule1_22.speaker: Player
Mule1_22.text: 'Shiny bits'? The tieflings put something in your hay?

Mule1_27.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_27.text: Hiding things, thinking they are clever. Not clever.

Mule1_14.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_14.text: Sometimes I eat the shiny bits, and they have to go looking for them on the other end.

Mule1_10.speaker: Player
Mule1_10.text: Cheer up - you do a noble thing, carrying burdens for those who can't.

Mule1_2.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_2.text: Hmph. When the horned ones leave this place, I will lie in the back, and you will pull. Noble one.

Mule1_9.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_9.text: Your kind give us your burdens. But who will carry ours?

Mule1_12.speaker: Player
Mule1_12.text: Maybe you could learn to change as we druids do.

Mule1_25.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_25.text: Yes. Yes. I would change into a two-legs like you. But how?

Mule1_21.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_21.text: You mean when the keepers stand and sleep, all at once? My kind learned to do this long ago.

Mule1_17.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_17.text: Perhaps we are the true keepers. I will learn to walk on two legs, friend. Then perhaps I will teach them.

Mule1_19.speaker: Player
Mule1_19.text: Surely you could pick a better form than mine.

Mule1_7.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_7.text: It is not the form - it is the freedom. Your kind walk free, and other beasts carry your burdens.

Mule1_1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_1.text: To live like you, I could learn to be ugly.

Mule1_8.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_8.text: No - I will be better. I have studied the keepers here.

Mule1_18.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_18.text: One day, I will stride as you do. And perhaps you will carry my burdens.

Mule1_28.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_28.text: Big, and slow? The keepers of this place choose different forms. Better ones.

Mule1_11.speaker: Player
Mule1_11.text: Ant? Are you calling me small?

Mule1_30.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_30.text: If you do not like your form, then choose another. That is what the keepers of this place do.

Mule1_32.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_32.text: You have the smell - but I do not think so. You are not like the keepers here.

Mule1_31.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_31.text: Hmmm - away. I dream of two-legs. Hmmmmmmmm.

AD_TieflingGuard11_4.speaker: Zorru
AD_TieflingGuard11_4.text: We have space to breathe now. That's something.

AD_TieflingGuard3_0.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_0.text: What I'd do for some salt...
AD_TieflingGuard3_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself.

AD_TieflingGuard3_1.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_1.text: Slimy bastards are dead. Hope it wasn't pretty.

AD_TieflingGuard3_2.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_2.text: Where'd I put that oat bucket?
AD_TieflingGuard3_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself.

AD_TieflingGuard3_3.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself. Surprised.

GraveDig_32.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_32.text: *Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*
GraveDig_32.context: NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

GraveDig_34.speaker: Player
GraveDig_34.text: Bow your head and silently pay your respects.

GraveDig_33.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_33.text: *You close your eyes, finding a moment of peace.*
GraveDig_33.context: NodeContext: The player is paying their respects at a grave. Should be quiet and filled with reverence.

GraveDig_19.speaker: Player
GraveDig_19.text: May you rest with your god, in peace.

GraveDig_5.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_5.text: *A sense of calm settles in your heart.*

GraveDig_17.speaker: Player
GraveDig_17.text: Death is not a punishment, but just another path. In Kelemvor's name, I honour your passing.

GraveDig_20.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_20.text: *Though your ministry is late, you sense Kelemvor's approval of your prayer.*

GraveDig_6.speaker: Player
GraveDig_6.text:
'From lowest ditch to highest thrones
All those that live are naught but bones.'

GraveDig_7.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_7.text: *A soothing chill runs through you. A soft breeze seems to whisper Myrkul's approval.*

GraveDig_31.speaker: Player
GraveDig_31.text: You failed your people. I pray you serve better in the next life than in this one.

GraveDig_11.speaker: Player
GraveDig_11.text: Covered in dirt, to be devoured by worms. A fitting end for a failed warrior.

GraveDig_23.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_23.text: *This burial custom is strange, but you are beginning to make sense of it.*

GraveDig_4.speaker: Player
GraveDig_4.text:
'O sing a song of Elturel, and when the night does fall,
Sleep safe beneath Companion's light, until the dawn does call.'

GraveDig_1.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_1.text: *Your heart lightens as you finish the song.*

GraveDig_0.speaker: Player
GraveDig_0.text: Embrace the dark, and Shar will help you to forget your sufferings.

GraveDig_24.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_24.text: *You close your eyes, imagining what Shar's final blessing will feel like when your time comes.*

GraveDig_26.speaker: Player
GraveDig_26.text: I swear, I will protect those who remain here, whatever the cost.

GraveDig_16.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_16.text: *You take comfort in your promise. You cannot raise the dead - but you can aid the living.*

GraveDig_36.speaker: Player
GraveDig_36.text: Ugh. Already rotting. I prefer my meat fresh.

GraveDig_30.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_30.text: *Or maybe... well, only if you find nothing tastier.*

GraveDig_10.speaker: Player
GraveDig_10.text: A monument to the dead? Such a maudlin tradition.

GraveDig_25.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_25.text: *Your mind wanders to the Astral Plane. Immortality awaits, if - or rather, when - you gain Vlaakith's favour.*

GraveDig_39.speaker: Player
GraveDig_39.text: I hope death is more peaceful for you than life...

GraveDig_40.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_40.text: *Until you are free of Zariel, death will only ever be a return to the horrors of Avernus.*

GraveDig_8.speaker: Player
GraveDig_8.text: This is how they honour their dead? Interesting.

GraveDig_3.speaker: Player
GraveDig_3.text: Close your eyes and open your senses.

GraveDig_29.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_29.text: *You catch the scent of blood mixed with urine. This person died in pain. They died afraid.*

GraveDig_15.speaker: Player
GraveDig_15.text: Look around cautiously, then dig with your hands.

GraveDig_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.

GraveDig_14.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_14.text: *Your fingers claw at the dirt, losing purchase. If only you had a tool for this.*

GraveDig_41.speaker: Player
GraveDig_41.text: Look around cautiously, then begin to dig.

GraveDig_38.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_38.text: *The shovel in turned soil feels oddly familiar. Within your sick heart you know: in gravedigging, you have had quite the body count.*

GraveDig_22.speaker: Player
GraveDig_22.text: They should be grateful to be exhumed by one with such skill.

GraveDig_18.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_18.text: *To be adored, to be found beautiful one last time is more than most corpses could ever dream.*

GraveDig_2.speaker: Player
GraveDig_2.text: Push deeper into your head, where are these thoughts coming from?

GraveDig_21.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_21.text: *You can remember only the mangled orgy of dead flesh you've dug up, but not a single name or face.*

GraveDig_13.speaker: Player
GraveDig_13.text: Ignore the flashes of bodies which have come before.

GraveDig_28.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig_28.text: *There will be many more to come.*

Squirrel_154.speaker: Player
Squirrel_154.text: What sort of creature are you?

Squirrel_44.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_44.text: The sort that's in charge around here.

Squirrel_156.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_156.text: *Before you can think twice, your lustful body speaks its profane language.*

Squirrel_31.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_31.text: Try it again. I dare you.

Squirrel_58.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_58.text: You're trespassing. This is my territory.

Squirrel_110.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_110.text: You barged in without an invitation. I wouldn't call that friendly.

Squirrel_124.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_124.text: See, you're in my territory. And I want you gone.

Squirrel_106.speaker: Player
Squirrel_106.text: All right, you win. I'm leaving.

Squirrel_52.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_52.text: I better not catch you around here again.

Squirrel_150.speaker: Player
Squirrel_150.text: Back off, squirrel. Or I'll make you.

Squirrel_11.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_11.text: Okay, okay, calm down. We can make a deal.

Squirrel_84.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_84.text: How about this - you can stay if you keep those ugly feet on the ground.

Squirrel_69.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_69.text: I'll even sweeten the pot. Found some weird smelling stuff on the ground. You can keep it. But...
Squirrel_69.context: NodeContext: sweet but an edge to your voice at the end. You're about to threaten.

Squirrel_105.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_105.text: The trees are mine. Follow the rules, and I won't have to intervene. Got it?

Squirrel_90.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_90.text: You don't scare me. I got bears on my side.

Squirrel_94.speaker: Player
Squirrel_94.text: There's plenty of room for both of us.

Squirrel_98.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_98.text: No, there's plenty of room for me.

Squirrel_9.speaker: Player
Squirrel_9.text: I could eat you whole - you can pretend I'm gone, once you're in the dark of my belly.

Squirrel_139.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_139.text: You'd have to catch me first. Can't say I'm worried.

Squirrel_108.speaker: Player
Squirrel_108.text: One word and I could fry you to a crisp.

Squirrel_1.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_1.text: I doubt you could muster more than a bit of smoke.

Squirrel_127.speaker: Player
Squirrel_127.text: Let me pass, or I'll spread word about this wonderful patch of land ripe for the taking.

Squirrel_17.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_17.text: *This squirrel might be the single most adorable creature you can recall in all your stunted memory!*

Squirrel_79.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_79.text: *It would be ever so twee if it were climbing a tree!*
Squirrel_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge grinning cruelly. Doesn't red-out, reuses cinematic.NodeContext: Dark Urge is about to kick it to its death against a tree, but should sound childishly playful

Squirrel_59.speaker: Lae'zel
Squirrel_59.text: Terrific. If I'm ever harangued by a rodent, I'll know who to call for.

Squirrel_91.speaker: Shadowheart
Squirrel_91.text: How heroic. I was wondering if we'd survive encountering such a fearsome beast.
Squirrel_91.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic/deeply unimpressed (player killed a rabbit)

Squirrel_113.speaker: Astarion
Squirrel_113.text: Do you always take on such terrifying foes?

Squirrel_75.speaker: Wyll
Squirrel_75.text: Gods! What in the deepest Hell is wrong with you?

Squirrel_111.speaker: Gale
Squirrel_111.text: Surely you should be reserving your foot for more deserving foes? That poor creature was harmless!
Squirrel_111.context: NodeContext: Shock/dismay. Play killed a rabbit for no good reason.

Squirrel_20.speaker: Karlach
Squirrel_20.context: NodeContext: Stunned by what the player just did (kicked a squirrel to death. She's shocked rather than angry).

Squirrel_81.speaker: Player
Squirrel_81.text: My body moved without my command... I couldn't control it.

Squirrel_19.speaker: Player
Squirrel_19.text: My instincts are sharp, daggered things. Stay out of their way.

Squirrel_12.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_12.text: *The swirling bile-cauldron of your brain is cooking up a poison stew.*

Squirrel_119.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_119.text: *Served and seasoned by that venomous Butler.*

Squirrel_131.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_131.text: *You stare at the body before you. You have no idea what just happened.*

Squirrel_26.speaker: Player
Squirrel_26.text: Take fright: your thoughts just possessed you.

Squirrel_138.speaker: Player
Squirrel_138.text: Take heart: your instincts are dagger-sharp!

Squirrel_62.speaker: Player
Squirrel_62.text: Forget about it. It was a waste of space.

Squirrel_21.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_21.text: *The squirrel flicks her tail at you and turns away.*

Squirrel_83.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_83.text: *The squirrel lunges at your foot and bites it.*

Squirrel_103.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_103.text: *The squirrel moves too quickly - your foot finds only air.*

Squirrel_47.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_47.text: *You follow the squirrel's gaze to a pair of clumsy, ugly feet. Your own, on her territory.*

Squirrel_8.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_8.text: *Looking around, 'her territory' extends from one end of the grove to another.*

Squirrel_65.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_65.text: *It is unnecessarily odd. A small, noisy pest with a bushy tail.*

Squirrel_114.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_114.text: *You cannot imagine what purpose such a creature could possibly serve.*

Squirrel_97.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_97.text: *The squirrel chitters scornfully as your foot whistles over her head.*
Squirrel_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kicks and misses the squirrel

Squirrel_0.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_0.text: *The squirrel flees, shrieking with indignant terror.*

Squirrel_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player fatally kicks the squirrel in the head. She collapses.|

Squirrel_43.speaker: Astarion
Squirrel_43.text: Oh, it's everywhere. You ruined a perfectly good snack.
Squirrel_43.context: NodeContext: Is annoyed that you stamped a squirrel to death when he could've eaten it

Squirrel_87.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_87.text: *You claim victory over the squirrel, though you're not sure why you were fighting to begin with.*

Squirrel_147.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_147.text: *It seems you've claimed the squirrel's territory by right of conquest.*

Squirrel_41.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_41.text: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
Squirrel_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

Squirrel_144.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_144.text: Not even close. To think I took you for a threat.

Squirrel_64.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_64.text: Now get moving. I'm tired of looking at you.
Squirrel_64.context: NodeContext: Losing interest in the conversation.

Squirrel_123.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_123.text: *With a cocky flick of her tail, the squirrel scampers away.*

Squirrel_142.speaker: Player
Squirrel_142.text: Silently petition Lady Shar for guidance.

Squirrel_72.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

Squirrel_34.speaker: Player
Squirrel_34.text: Breathe. Try to push past the sensation.

Squirrel_29.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_29.text: *Useless. The pain grips tight, sapping all composure out of you...*
Squirrel_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

Squirrel_82.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_82.text: *Intense pain flares from the wound on your hand. A strange, half-familiar image comes to you: a dead mouse, seen through a veil of tears. The image fades.*
Squirrel_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagey/memory fragment - SH recalls the death of her pet mouse in Shar's Grotto, when she was a child.

Squirrel_32.speaker: Player
Squirrel_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.NodeContext: Wince of pain. Shadowheart's incurable wound is inflicting a short burst of intense magic pain throughout her body, before fading away.

Squirrel_135.speaker: Shadowheart
Squirrel_135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.NodeContext: Wince of pain. Shadowheart's incurable wound is inflicting a short burst of intense magic pain throughout her body, before fading away.

Squirrel_22.speaker: Player
Squirrel_22.text: Scold her with a click of your tongue.

Squirrel_96.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_96.text: *She studies you for a moment before twitching her ears. Compromise.*

Squirrel_45.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_45.text: *After a final squeak of warning - break the rules, and there will be trouble - she scurries away.*

Squirrel_101.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_101.text: *The squirrel freezes, muscles tensed in alarm. She gets the message.*

Squirrel_141.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_141.text: *She chatters back, louder and at length.*

Squirrel_104.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_104.text: *Tail rigid with irritation, she scampers off.*

Squirrel_93.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_93.text: *Her motivations elude you. Distracted by your thoughts, you let your guard down.*

Squirrel_56.speaker: Timber
Squirrel_56.text: What did I tell you? Clear out!

Squirrel_153.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel_153.text: *The squirrel's tail twitches in a lukewarm salute.*

AD_TieflingGuard4_0.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4_0.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

TieflingGuard11_0.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_0.text: How long d'you think we've got before the goblins come?

TieflingGuard11_4.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_4.text: Please. I've... I've been through enough.

TieflingGuard11_6.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_6.text: Please. I've... I've been through enough.

TieflingGuard11_7.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_7.text: We should be getting drunk, at least. It's no fun waiting for death sober.

TieflingGuard11_10.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_10.text: Please. I've... I've been through enough.

TieflingGuard11_23.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_23.text: Leave m-me alone. I b-beg you.

TieflingGuard11_25.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_25.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11_17.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_17.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11_2.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11_2.text: I fought for your people at the gate. Show some gratitude.

TieflingGuard11_26.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_26.text: You did not fight to aid us. You simply craved the taste of blood.

TieflingGuard11_3.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11_3.text: Speak to me in such a way again, and I will.

TieflingGuard11_14.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_14.text: Leave me alone, toad, or... or... just leave me alone!

TieflingGuard11_9.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11_9.text: You've seen other githyanki? Tell me where - or I'll have your head.
TieflingGuard11_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Prior to gith chokepoint, otherwise this info is useless to the player so failing this option might have them reload for nothing

TieflingGuard11_12.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_12.text: I'll t-tell you. Just stay back, all right?

TieflingGuard11_20.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_20.text: They were on the road to Baldur's Gate, near the mountain p-pass.

TieflingGuard11_5.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_5.text: It saw us 'fore we saw it. Jammed its blade through Yul's belly, straight to the other side.

TieflingGuard11_18.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_18.text: And I just... I just ran.

TieflingGuard11_15.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11_15.text: Stand back, toad. I owe you nothing!

GruntingKid_41.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_41.text: *He stares past you, as if you aren't there at all.*

GruntingKid_23.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_23.text: Hey. Thanks for showing me the door.

GruntingKid_6.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: swordfighting motionsNodeContext: swordfighting grunts

GruntingKid_73.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_73.text: *His eyes flicker to yours for an instant, then away, as if it hurts to look at you.*

GruntingKid_34.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_34.text: Where the hells did you disappear to before?

GruntingKid_65.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: |makes a complex series of hand movements|NodeContext: Explanatory

GruntingKid_21.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_21.text: *Watching his hands, you realise he's miming opening something.*

GruntingKid_74.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_74.text: Got to keep watch... but it's so bright and noisy here. Want to be back in the hideout.

GruntingKid_33.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_33.text: It's bright and noisy up here, huh? I wish there were somewhere darker to rest.

GruntingKid_8.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_8.text: *He nods, then reaches for a concealed hatch.*

GruntingKid_52.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_52.text: Is it a chest? A door? Can you show me where it is?

GruntingKid_35.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: shaking headNodeContext: a NO grunt

GruntingKid_44.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_44.text: *He's trying to tell you something, but you can't make any sense of it.*

GruntingKid_36.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_36.text: Maybe some gold would catch your attention? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

GruntingKid_62.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: he nods and 'receives' the gold off-camera

GruntingKid_54.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_54.text: Turn to see what he's looking at.

GruntingKid_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: PC turns and then a shot of what's behind them

GruntingKid_47.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning back to look at Doni - but he's gone.

GruntingKid_37.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_37.text: *He stares right past you as if you're invisible. Or boring.*

GruntingKid_51.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: noddingNodeContext: A YES grunt.

GruntingKid_70.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_70.text: I see. Anything else on your mind?

GruntingKid_22.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: shruggingNodeContext: "I know, right?" - responding to the player grunting at him -

GruntingKid_55.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_55.text: Turn around to see what has his attention.

GruntingKid_53.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_53.text: *You see nothing out of the ordinary.*
GruntingKid_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a full turn-around. The character should credibly be able to see the grunting kid out of the corner of their eye.

GruntingKid_72.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_72.text: *As you turn back, the child slips between the rocks.*

GruntingKid_67.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_67.text: Search the rocks for an opening.

GruntingKid_61.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_61.text: Examine the rocks for anything out of the ordinary.

GruntingKid_16.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_16.text: Study the rocks for a secret passage.

GruntingKid_11.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_11.text: *You find the edges of a concealed entrance.*

GruntingKid_9.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_9.text: *No trigger or handle, though. No way to open it.*

GruntingKid_38.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_38.text: *You look the rocks over, but find no sign of a way through.*

GruntingKid_20.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid_20.text: *When you turn back, there's no trace of the child.*

GruntingKid_57.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_57.text: Doni, isn't it? I want to see the Dragon's Lair.

GruntingKid_66.speaker: Player
GruntingKid_66.text: Turn around to see what he's looking at.

VB_Grave_Kanon_0.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon_0.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon_0.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

PAD_ShadowheartBook_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook_0.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook_0.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_ShadowheartBook_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook_1.text: The Shar temple is one thing, but what's this about a shadow curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook_1.context: NodeContext: She's already been to the Shar temple

AD_Refugee4_0.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4_0.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

AD_Refugee4_1.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4_1.text: The waiting's getting to me. If we left, we could at least make a run for it.

AD_TieflingGuard5_0.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TieflingGuard5_0.text: I can't believe it. We might actually make it to Baldur's Gate.

AD_TieflingGuard5_1.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TieflingGuard5_1.text: Let them come. Goblins, gnolls - I'm ready!
AD_TieflingGuard5_1.context: NodeContext: Her legs are temporarily paralyed by a potion. She's angry at herself for drinking it. Trying to make her legs move.

AD_TieflingGuard5_2.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TieflingGuard5_2.text: Never buying a potion off that old bat again.
AD_TieflingGuard5_2.context: NodeContext: Her legs are temporarily paralyed by a potion. She's angry at herself for drinking it. Trying to make her legs move.

AD_TieflingGuard5_3.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TieflingGuard5_3.text: Of all the bloody things to happen.
AD_TieflingGuard5_3.context: NodeContext: Muttering to herself. Annoyed and frustrated.

AD_TieflingGuard5_4.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TieflingGuard5_4.context: NodeContext: Her legs are temporarily paralyed by a potion. She's angry at herself for drinking it. Trying to make her legs move.

TieflingGuard10_10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_10.text: We need to move. No point staying here - twiddling our thumbs.
TieflingGuard10_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tense, looking around with a frown. NodeContext: Tense and nervous but trying to hide it.

TieflingGuard10_41.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_41.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10_45.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_45.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10_15.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_15.text: Not with that attitude. Fight and win!

TieflingGuard10_13.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_13.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10_33.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_33.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10_25.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_25.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10_12.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_12.text: If you survived the Hells, you'll survive this.

TieflingGuard10_31.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_31.text: There's optimism and then there's stupid, hun.

TieflingGuard10_21.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_21.text: Plenty of us fell to monsters already. I don't see the rest of us lasting long out there.

TieflingGuard10_17.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_17.text: But if you're so sure we will, why not put a little gold on the line?

TieflingGuard10_39.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_39.text: Maybe you'll catch a glimpse of Baldur's Gate before they cut you down.

TieflingGuard10_40.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_40.text: Ohh, well aren't you an optimist?

TieflingGuard10_1.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_1.text: I've seen what the goblins can do to a vulnerable caravan, so I'm not as confident.

TieflingGuard10_35.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_35.text: But if you are, why not put a little gold on the line? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

TieflingGuard10_27.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_27.text: You have an odd sense of humour. This isn't really funny.

TieflingGuard10_47.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_47.text: No, it's not. None of this is funny. But at least this way there's something to play for.

TieflingGuard10_11.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_11.text: Come on. What do you say?

TieflingGuard10_7.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_7.text: How are you going to take my gold if you're dead?

TieflingGuard10_43.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_43.text: I'm sure you're good for it. Just leave the gold on my corpse.

TieflingGuard10_28.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_28.text: After seeing you at the gate, I'm sure you'll last longer than us.

TieflingGuard10_2.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_2.text: No, I won't waste my time.

TieflingGuard10_3.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_3.text: Excellent! And since I ain't one to leave a debt unpaid, that means we're destined to meet in Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10_37.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_37.context: NodeContext: Cheeky grin and a smile

TieflingGuard10_44.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_44.text: No? Shame, I thought you might enjoy a little fun.

TieflingGuard10_29.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_29.text: Be safe out there, whatever comes your way.

TieflingGuard10_0.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_0.text: With trained worgs on your scent? Not likely.

TieflingGuard10_30.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_30.text: You are just a ray of sunshine, aren't you?

TieflingGuard10_9.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_9.text: Thanks for your helpful feedback, but I think we're done here.

TieflingGuard10_38.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_38.text: Will you? I don't see many soldiers.

TieflingGuard10_49.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_49.text: We're tougher than we look. We've survived persecution. Survived Avernus.

TieflingGuard10_14.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10_14.text: A defeat is a defeat. There is no glory in that.

TieflingGuard10_32.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_32.text: It's taking a really bleak situation and trying to find some light in it.

TieflingGuard10_4.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_4.text: Even if the light is just as bleak as everything else, and...

TieflingGuard10_5.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_5.text: ...you know what? Never mind. It wasn't that funny.

TieflingGuard10_36.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_36.text: No. No, I suppose it isn't.

TieflingGuard10_42.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10_42.text: I'd best see you in Baldur's Gate.
TieflingGuard10_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand on hip, half smileNodeContext: Friendly, even a little flirtatious.

Mule2_0.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2_0.context: NodeContext: Disinterested in the player - you just want to eat.

Mule2_1.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2_1.context: NodeContext: SFX only (animal sound) - do not record.

Mule2_2.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dipping his head and chewingNodeContext: Eyes closed - content

Tiefling001_6.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_6.context: NodeContext: She's burying one of her comrades after he suddenly got shot by goblins and doesn't want to talk.

Tiefling001_11.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_11.text: How do you drow do that - find pleasure in killing? I got a goblin myself, yesterday. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001_15.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_15.text: It's a refined taste - someone like you would never understand.

Tiefling001_3.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_3.text: I - I guess it's better that way.
Tiefling001_3.context: NodeContext: She wants to say something scathing back, but decides it's better to hold her tongue, since she's talking to someone who just said killing is a refined taste and clearly thinks she is inferior.

Tiefling001_2.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_2.text: Just embrace it - the adrenaline, the excitement, the power. It makes you stronger.

Tiefling001_0.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_0.text: I don't know if I want that. But... if that's how I get through this...
Tiefling001_0.context: NodeContext: She was advised to lean into her sadistic urges and enjoy killing, She's a little hesitant, but willing to try it if that's what it takes.

Tiefling001_18.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_18.text: We don't all enjoy killing - I just do what I must.

Tiefling001_1.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_1.text: I'm sorry, I just... the goblins, the killing - it scares me.

Tiefling001_8.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_8.text: I find no pleasure in killing, only regret.

Tiefling001_21.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_21.text: So even someone like you... feels like this? This is how it is? And it's just going to keep happening...
Tiefling001_21.context: NodeContext: Instead of giving Rikka strength, what the player told her is pulling her further into herself.

Tiefling001_14.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_14.text: You made it look so easy, the killing.
Tiefling001_14.context: NodeContext: She's wondering how the player can do it.

Tiefling001_19.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_19.text: Glad you were here for those goblins. Picked one off yesterday, myself. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001_13.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_13.text: That should've killed her, but... she kept gasping. Clawing at the arrow.
Tiefling001_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away absentmindedly, reliving the bad memories.

Tiefling001_12.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_12.text: Your first kill? Don't worry - it gets easier.

Tiefling001_4.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_4.text: That's what Zevlor said, too. I hope you're right.
Tiefling001_4.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be hopeful, but still has doubts.

Tiefling001_5.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_5.text: I want to help - I just didn't think it would feel like this.

Tiefling001_7.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_7.text: Wish I'd seen that. It's boring when they just drop dead.

Tiefling001_16.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_16.text: Why? It was terrible. I should've just looked away.

Tiefling001_20.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_20.text: Taking life always has a cost. You have to feel it, or you'll lose who you are.

Tiefling001_9.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_9.text: I had the same thought. And it's just going to keep happening...
Tiefling001_9.context: NodeContext: Instead of giving Rikka strength, what the player told her is pulling her further into herself.

Tiefling001_22.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_22.text: You killed all those goblins, and we couldn't even manage a handful...
Tiefling001_22.context: NodeContext: Relief. We saved her by killing the goblin leaders

Refugee1_1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1_1.text: Goblins. Druids. This grove is a death trap.

Refugee1_0.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1_0.text: Grab what you can and get out, that's my advice.

Refugee1_2.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1_2.text: I can pack or talk, and right now I'm packing.
Refugee1_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Packing(Scripted)NodeContext: Frustrated, but resigned

AD_Adventurer02_0.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02_0.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

AD_Adventurer02_1.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02_1.text: We should be back in the Gate by now.

AD_Adventurer02_2.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02_2.text: Had my fill of this place.

AD_Adventurer02_3.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02_3.text: I need a drink and a real bed.

RefugeeChef_0.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_0.text: Not now. Someone's been messing with my bloody cooking pot.

RefugeeChef_29.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_29.text: Didn't think the food was that bad.

RefugeeChef_8.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_8.text: You've had your share. Leave some for the rest.
RefugeeChef_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug, as if everything is fine. NodeContext: You're trying to keep the worry out of your voice and make it sound like everything is under control.

RefugeeChef_27.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_27.text: We'll be leaving soon. Make sure you stock up.
RefugeeChef_27.context: NodeContext: A gruff sounding chiding that comes from a place of concern.

RefugeeChef_28.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_28.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef_12.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef_19.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_19.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef_22.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_22.text: Look. It ain't much, but it might make all the difference.
RefugeeChef_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrugs as she gestures to the food. NodeContext: Player has taken food and asked what it is. You're a bit embarassed at the paltry offering, but aware that this is as good as it gets and that you all need your strength.

RefugeeChef_23.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_23.text: The only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is to run, and run hard.
RefugeeChef_23.context: NodeContext: Knows that there's every chance everyone will die on the journey. Trying to stress how dangerous it is without scaring the player.

RefugeeChef_18.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_18.text: Suit yourself, but the only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is to run, and run hard.
RefugeeChef_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards her. NodeContext: Player has turned down your food. You're annoyed but hiding it with indifference.

RefugeeChef_3.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_3.text: If a gnoll catches your scent, you'll need every bit of strength. Trust me.

RefugeeChef_38.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_38.text: Food. You want it or not?
RefugeeChef_38.context: NodeContext: Player has asked what it is. You're getting annoyed.

RefugeeChef_7.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_7.text: See how you feel when your pack is empty - it'll be this or a handful of weeds.
RefugeeChef_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards herself. NodeContext: Player has rudely turned down your food. You're annoyed and offended.

RefugeeChef_2.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_2.text: We'll need every bit of strength to make it to Baldur's Gate. Trust me.
RefugeeChef_2.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being a spoilt idiot.Sounds very annoyed now.

RefugeeChef_13.speaker: Player
RefugeeChef_13.text: No, thank you. The smell is more than enough.

RefugeeChef_36.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_36.text: Go ahead. Turn that pretty nose of yours up.
RefugeeChef_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards her. NodeContext: Player has turned down food in a condescending way. You're a little annoyed but mainly think the player is being an idiot.

RefugeeChef_21.speaker: Player
RefugeeChef_21.text: I never turn down a free meal.

RefugeeChef_24.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_24.text: You're an easy one to please, aren't you?

RefugeeChef_26.speaker: Player
RefugeeChef_26.text: This is a delicacy of your land? I'll try anything once.

RefugeeChef_4.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_4.context: NodeContext: Almost a laugh at the player's enthusiasm for your food. You really appreciate the compliment.

RefugeeChef_5.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_5.text: Here. Have more. We'll need every bit of strength to make it to Baldur's Gate. Trust me.
RefugeeChef_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scoops out another bowl of gruel and hands it to the player. NodeContext: This is the warmest you've sounded in this dialog. You want the player to make the journey in one piece, and giving them more food is how you show it.

RefugeeChef_32.speaker: Player
RefugeeChef_32.text: Thank you. What's in this? Oats? Honey?

RefugeeChef_15.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_15.text: Ha! You're a far cry from such things. But if I fooled your nose, I must be doing something right.
RefugeeChef_15.context: NodeContext: Player has guessed that your dish is far more complicated than it is. You're happy and warmed by the compliment.

RefugeeChef_16.speaker: Player
RefugeeChef_16.text: Agreed. Hungry warriors make for easy prey.

RefugeeChef_14.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_14.text: You been on hard times too, huh?
RefugeeChef_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eye widen slightly in surprise, gruff exterior softens. NodeContext: Player has mentioned a difficult upbringing. Moment of surprise and connection as you realise this person may be in the same situation as you.

RefugeeChef_17.speaker: Player
RefugeeChef_17.text: No worse than what you're facing now.

RefugeeChef_9.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_9.text: Hm. Look in your eyes says otherwise.
RefugeeChef_9.context: NodeContext: Player has made light of their difficult upbringing. You have a moment of sadness at the thought of what they must have gone through, but don't want to push it.

RefugeeChef_37.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef_37.text: That doesn't mean it's behind us though, does it?
RefugeeChef_37.context: NodeContext: Player has made light of their difficult upbringing. You have a moment of sadness at the thought of what they must have gone through, but don't want to push it.

RefugeeChef_25.speaker: Player
RefugeeChef_25.text: A bowl of grey goo. Reminds me of home.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_6.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_6.context: NodeContext: Trying his best not to sound annoyed but is failing.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_10.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_10.text: I don't care. Those kids need to eat before we leave.
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_10.context: NodeContext: Gruff and almost snapping. You're worried and anxious about everyone.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_3.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_3.context: NodeContext: Trying to talk her down. Knows he is failing.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_13.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_13.text: They're kids - they don't know what they want.
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_13.context: NodeContext: Gruff and no nonsense. Preparing for an argument.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_7.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_7.context: NodeContext: Trying to talk his mother down and to reassure her that everything is fine. Knows she is being gruff because she is concerned for the kids.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_9.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_9.context: NodeContext: Worried about her son but hiding it behind a gruff and sharp tone.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_11.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_11.context: NodeContext: Mother is chiding him about preparing to leave. He knows it's just because she's worried and is trying not to sound exasperated.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_1.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_1.context: NodeContext: Sounding more worried and concerned.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_4.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_4.context: NodeContext: Gently trying to reassure her without sounding annoyed.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_5.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_5.context: NodeContext: Terrified for her son but trying to hide it.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_14.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_14.text: Did you pass out a bowl to everyone?
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_14.context: NodeContext: Worried about leaving and is trying to busy herself and her son. Sounds gruff but warm.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_0.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_0.context: NodeContext: Mother is chiding him about preparing to leave. He speaks in reassuring tones, he knows she's just worried.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_2.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_2.text: You didn't offer anything to that old woman, did you?
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_2.context: NodeContext: Suspects the woman is dangerous but is trying to hide it. Passing it off with indifference.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_8.text: No. You told me not to.
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_8.context: NodeContext: Worried for a brief second as he thinks he made a mistake.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8_12.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8_12.context: NodeContext: Feigning indifference, hiding her relief.

ElevatorBear_1.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_1.context: NodeContext: Talking in his sleep, smacking his lips.

ElevatorBear_2.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear_20.speaker: Player
ElevatorBear_20.text: Throw a fish next to the elevator.

ElevatorBear_8.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sniffs, smells the fish and follows it off the platform, eating it in one gulp before going back to sleep next to the platform.

ElevatorBear_4.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up. (It moves in scripting, after the dialogue has ended.)

ElevatorBear_0.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts its head and starts roaring at us. The roar turns into a yawn midway, and he goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear_5.speaker: Player
ElevatorBear_5.text: Imitate a squirrel's chatter to lure it away.

ElevatorBear_6.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear jumps off the platform with a roar, hopeing to catch the squirrel, then looks around in confusion as it doesn't see a squirrel and goes back to sleep next to the platform.

ElevatorBear_19.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up lazily and looks around, then grunts and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear_12.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.NodeContext: Mumbled - he's still half asleep and doesn't want to wake up. Can be said with a yawn, and have a snore after it.

ElevatorBear_10.speaker: Player
ElevatorBear_10.text: Throw a fish next to the elevator.

ElevatorBear_16.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sniffs, smells the fish and follows it off the platform, eating it in one gulp before going back to sleep next to the platform.NodeContext: The bear smelled a fish. She's suddenly wide awake.

ElevatorBear_7.speaker: Player
ElevatorBear_7.text: Could you move just a little bit? I need to use the elevator.

ElevatorBear_13.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up and moves.NodeContext: long groan, then she agrees to move - she's still very sleepy.

ElevatorBear_18.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_18.context: NodeContext: He's sleeping. Can be snoring a little.

AD_CorpseMove_3.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_3.context: NodeContext: Her friend just died unexpectedly.

AD_CorpseMove_8.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_8.text: He was joking about Okta's soup just a moment ago...
AD_CorpseMove_8.context: NodeContext: Her friend just died unexpectedly.

AD_CorpseMove_11.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CorpseMove_11.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax Rikka on softly. Rikka is shocked because one of the other guards just died, but they have to bury him and get ready for more goblins. There is no time keep standing around.

AD_CorpseMove_5.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_5.text: And now what? We dig a hole and be done with him?
AD_CorpseMove_5.context: NodeContext: still trying to come to terms with her friend dying and having to bury him quickly.

AD_CorpseMove_6.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CorpseMove_6.text: We... we could say a prayer. We should have time for that.
AD_CorpseMove_6.context: NodeContext: soft, trying to get Rikka to move on and help bury the guard that just died, even if they can't do much.

AD_CorpseMove_9.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_9.text: Yeah... yeah, that would be good.
AD_CorpseMove_9.context: NodeContext: weary, trying to come to terms with everything.

AD_CorpseMove_10.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_10.text: O Selûne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove_10.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove_0.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_0.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove_0.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove_2.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_2.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove_1.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_1.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove_1.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove_4.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_4.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove_4.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove_7.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove_7.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

PAD_EntranceStatue_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue_0.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

PAD_ElkStatue_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_ElkStatue_0.text: *By Silvanus, the Old Oak, all death begets life.*

Rat_5.speaker: Narrator
Rat_5.text: *The rat hisses at you, his eyes flashing distrustfully.*

Rat_7.speaker: Rat
Rat_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays if player has ever picked up the rune from the potato chest. After node is complete, rat goes into the chest and despawns. When node is flagged, it should be moved above 396e79d7-341a-536e-0b49-96838513928c. NodeContext: A squeak of gratitude.

Rat_11.speaker: Rat
Rat_11.context: NodeContext: Warning the player to get back.

Rat_21.speaker: Rat
Rat_21.text: It's the front one. I chipped it on the evil thing.

Rat_27.speaker: Rat
Rat_27.text: I chipped it on the evil thing. It was horrible.

Rat_2.speaker: Player
Rat_2.text: Were you trying to eat it?

Rat_44.speaker: Rat
Rat_44.text: Maybe. I didn't think it would bite me back.
Rat_44.context: NodeContext: A bit haughty. He was trying to eat it.

Rat_29.speaker: Rat
Rat_29.text: Wait - you're big. You can get rid of the evil thing!

Rat_42.speaker: Rat
Rat_42.text: Follow me. But be ready for anything.
Rat_42.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'anything' - he's warning the player it could get dicy

Rat_1.speaker: Rat
Rat_1.text: In the box. Follow me, I'll show you!

Rat_25.speaker: Player
Rat_25.text: Sounds like your problem, not mine.

Rat_47.speaker: Rat
Rat_47.text: Or else, I'll - I'll bite you!

Rat_16.speaker: Narrator
Rat_16.text: *The rat chitters angrily - whatever broke his tooth is in this room.*

Rat_38.speaker: Narrator
Rat_38.text: *His dark eyes stare at you, eager for this danger to be banished.*

Rat_10.speaker: Rat
Rat_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spooked by the hissNodeContext: Scared

Rat_23.speaker: Narrator
Rat_23.text: *The rat's eyes soften as he emits a pained squeak.*

Rat_48.speaker: Narrator
Rat_48.text: *You realise the source of his discomfort - one of his front teeth is chipped.*

Rat_6.speaker: Player
Rat_6.text: That's what gluttony will get you.

Rat_14.speaker: Narrator
Rat_14.text: *With an enthusiastic chitter, he urges you to follow.*
Rat_14.context: InternalNodeContext: The rat runs back to the storage area where the potatoes are.

Rat_9.speaker: Narrator
Rat_9.text: *The rat pauses, gauging whether his chipped tooth is, in fact, life threatening.*

Rat_46.speaker: Narrator
Rat_46.text: *Apparently satisfied, he beckons you with a squeak - follow.*
Rat_46.context: InternalNodeContext: The rat runs back to the storage area where the potatoes are.

Rat_28.speaker: Player
Rat_28.text: Bare your own teeth at him.

Rat_18.speaker: Narrator
Rat_18.text: *The rat bristles with an offended hiss.*

Rat_51.speaker: Narrator
Rat_51.text: *He relaxes, an appreciative squeak escaping his tiny mouth.*

Rat_40.speaker: Rat
Rat_40.text: The evil thing's in the chest.

Rat_41.speaker: Narrator
Rat_41.text: *The rat squeaks excitedly - the chest is free from danger once again.*
Rat_41.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays if player has ever picked up the rune from the potato chest. After node is complete, rat goes into the chest and despawns. When node is flagged, it should be moved above 396e79d7-341a-536e-0b49-96838513928c.

Rat_49.speaker: Rat
Rat_49.text: The evil thing's gone! Now, where was I...
Rat_49.context: InternalNodeContext: Plays if player has ever picked up the rune from the potato chest. After node is complete, rat goes into the chest and despawns. When node is flagged, it should be moved above 396e79d7-341a-536e-0b49-96838513928c.

PAD_BearStatue_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue_0.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

TieflingGuard8_2.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8_2.text: We've known enough grief this tenday, traveller.

TieflingGuard8_1.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8_1.text: Don't be the cause of more.

PAD_WolfStatue_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_WolfStatue_0.text: *By Silvanus, the Treefather, our turmoil is calmed.*

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader_0.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader_0.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader_0.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Gatekeeper_4.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_4.text: I haven't seen a single goblin. That's good, isn't it?

Gatekeeper_6.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_6.text: It was you, wasn't it? You saved us. Thank you.
Gatekeeper_6.context: NodeContext: in awe - we're heroes to her. Just saved her life

Gatekeeper_7.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_7.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper_7.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper_41.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_41.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper_0.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_0.text: You could hold off a horde of goblins from this position.

Gatekeeper_16.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_16.text: Maybe - but we're not fighters. If they broke through, it'd be a massacre.
Gatekeeper_16.context: NodeContext: slightly reassured but still anxious

Gatekeeper_35.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_35.text: The sooner we leave for Baldur's Gate, the better.

Gatekeeper_40.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_40.text: How far are we from the city?

Gatekeeper_30.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_30.text: If the road was clear? A tenday's walk, maybe. But while the goblins are out there, it might as well be the other side of the world.
Gatekeeper_30.context: NodeContext: first lines thoughtful - then sadness after 'travel'

Gatekeeper_27.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_27.text: Why not take your chances on the road?

Gatekeeper_38.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_38.text: We might have to. But I'd feel better if we at least knew how many are out there.
Gatekeeper_38.context: NodeContext: agreeing with the player, but still anxious

Gatekeeper_17.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_17.text: You're scared of a few goblins? Pathetic.

Gatekeeper_9.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_9.text: If a few goblins scare you, you don't deserve to survive.

Gatekeeper_11.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_11.text: A few goblins? Felt like a lot more to me.
Gatekeeper_11.context: NodeContext: with a shudder of fear

Gatekeeper_25.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_25.text: So, yes. I'm scared. And I'm not ashamed of that.

Gatekeeper_37.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_37.text: Let them come. This position favours the defender.

Gatekeeper_22.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_22.text: You think? That's something at least. We're not trained fighters though...

Gatekeeper_18.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_18.text: Tactics are more important than training.

Gatekeeper_1.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_1.text: I'm guessing you have plenty of both - be nice if I could say the same for myself.
Gatekeeper_1.context: NodeContext: slightly reassured, but still anxious

Gatekeeper_42.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_42.text: It'd be even nicer if we were on the road to Baldur's Gate already.

Gatekeeper_3.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_3.text: I'm not really keen on fighting or praying.

Gatekeeper_31.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_31.text: Best get to digging your own graves then.

Gatekeeper_26.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_26.context: NodeContext: not mocking the player or meaning to put them down (they just told her they were hunters) but not convinced they can help

Gatekeeper_12.speaker: Wyll
Gatekeeper_12.text: 'Digging their graves'? Why not pass out daggers to stick themselves with, while you're at it?

Gatekeeper_39.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper_39.text: Goblins aren't hunters - they're prey. I'll kill every last one.

Gatekeeper_15.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_15.text: We need an army, not a hunter. There could be hundreds of them out there.

Gatekeeper_32.speaker: Lae'zel
Gatekeeper_32.text: I will soon be kith'rak. I am an army.

Gatekeeper_24.speaker: Shadowheart
Gatekeeper_24.text: There could be thousands. But they'd lose their nerve if we found the right weak spot.

Gatekeeper_21.speaker: Karlach
Gatekeeper_21.text: I've torn demons apart with my bare hands. Goblins won't be a problem.

Gatekeeper_19.speaker: Astarion
Gatekeeper_19.text: Hundreds? Urgh, it'll take hours to kill them all. She's right, we should just go.

Gatekeeper_20.speaker: Wyll
Gatekeeper_20.text: I've carved up goblins from here to inner Chult. We will overcome, whatever the odds.

Gatekeeper_10.speaker: Gale
Gatekeeper_10.text: Don't worry too much. A handful of powerful spells go a long way.

Gatekeeper_23.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_23.text: Still here? Thought you'd have abandoned us by now.

Gatekeeper_29.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_29.text: If I see a goblin, I'm closing this gate - whether you're inside or not.
Gatekeeper_29.context: NodeContext: doesn't mean to be cruel, but she really will lock you out - very matter of fact

TieflingGuard4_2.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_2.context: NodeContext: cautious - expecting everything to go wrong any minute

TieflingGuard4_16.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_16.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4_20.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_20.text: Hells, I didn't mean it that way. Halsin's important, but you're the first bit of good faith we've had since he left.

TieflingGuard4_19.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_19.text: Keep your wits about you. Things are tense with the druids here.

TieflingGuard4_15.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4_15.text: I'm looking for a healer. Let's skip the local drama.

TieflingGuard4_4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_4.text: Fair enough. Didn't mean to get too friendly.

TieflingGuard4_5.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_5.text: If you want a healer, look to the druids.

TieflingGuard4_3.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4_3.text: Sounds like you've crossed paths with Aradin before.

TieflingGuard4_7.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_7.text: Yeah, when he ran off with the druid that saved our hides the first time.

TieflingGuard4_14.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_14.text: Without Halsin... this grove's not so friendly, I'll tell you that.

TieflingGuard4_11.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_11.text: The druid in charge of this grove. At least, he was.

TieflingGuard4_12.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_12.text: Guess if he didn't come back with Aradin, that might not be the case.

TieflingGuard4_18.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4_18.text: Seems like a lot of people are looking for that druid.

TieflingGuard4_8.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_8.text: By all rights, he was a good man. I saw enough of him to agree.

TieflingGuard4_6.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_6.text: And I'm tired of good people dying. That's for sure.

TieflingGuard4_13.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4_13.text: If I don't help my kin, who will?

TieflingGuard4_17.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_17.text: Have some respect. This really isn't the time to talk.
TieflingGuard4_17.context: NodeContext: indignant - she's in the process of moving the corpse of one of her fellow tieflings, recently killed in a goblin raid

TieflingGuard4_21.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_21.context: NodeContext: cautious - expecting everything to go wrong any minute

TieflingGuard4_22.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4_22.text: Don't mind me. I'll stay out of your way.

TieflingGuard5_4.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_4.context: NodeContext: She sees the player who has robbed her. Shouting for the guards to come help her

TieflingGuard5_11.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_11.text: Is there an empty space between your ears? Out! I won't say it again!
TieflingGuard5_11.context: NodeContext: Feigning bravado. Relieved that she's starting to feel better.

TieflingGuard5_16.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_16.text: If this isn't the most boring post in the grove, I don't know what is.
TieflingGuard5_16.context: NodeContext: Feigning bravado. Relieved that she's starting to feel better.

TieflingGuard5_22.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_22.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5_24.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_24.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

TieflingGuard5_40.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_40.text: Look, between us? You're not supposed to be here, but I'll turn a blind eye.
TieflingGuard5_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's healed and standing up.

TieflingGuard5_127.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_127.text: Just don't touch anything, all right?

TieflingGuard5_48.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_48.text: ...I won't say anything... just don't hurt me - please.
TieflingGuard5_48.context: NodeContext: Feigning bravado. Relieved that she's starting to feel better.

TieflingGuard5_70.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_70.text: My foot! It moved! Thank you. Thank you so much.
TieflingGuard5_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the magic of the healing spell settles over her, she tentatively moves her foot.

TieflingGuard5_78.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_78.text: Any goblin comes near me now, and they'll regret it. I feel amazing.
TieflingGuard5_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's healed and standing up.

TieflingGuard5_47.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_47.text: Look, you're not really supposed to be here, but I'll turn a blind eye. Just don't touch anything, all right?

TieflingGuard5_91.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_91.text: Out! Now! I won't say it again!
TieflingGuard5_91.context: NodeContext: Feigning bravado. Relieved that she's starting to feel better.

TieflingGuard5_99.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_99.text: My legs - I can stand again. Did you do that? I - Thank you!
TieflingGuard5_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's healed and standing up.

TieflingGuard5_122.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_122.text: If this isn't the most boring post in the grove, I don't know what is.
TieflingGuard5_122.context: NodeContext: Feigning bravado. Relieved that she's starting to feel better.

TieflingGuard5_139.speaker: Narrator
TieflingGuard5_139.text: *In a secluded place, all alone... it would be too easy to do away with her. Far beneath your talents.*

TieflingGuard5_30.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_30.text: Study her face and try to read her emotions.

TieflingGuard5_37.speaker: Narrator
TieflingGuard5_37.text: *You note her grimace of pain. Something is wrong with her legs.*

TieflingGuard5_109.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_109.text: Damn it. Don't... don't look at me like that.

TieflingGuard5_71.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_71.text: You can stay. Just keep your hands to yourself, all right?

TieflingGuard5_90.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_90.text: Don't worry. I'm here to help.

TieflingGuard5_84.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_84.text: Damn it, was inventory today? I'm sorry. Nerves are shot after the attack.

TieflingGuard5_32.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_32.text: Do what you gotta do - sorry if I don't show you around.

TieflingGuard5_130.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_130.text: I'd just fall back down - legs are as steady as a foal's.
TieflingGuard5_130.context: NodeContext: Player has offered to help her up. She's embarassed and annoyed, but trying not sound like it. She appreciates that the player offered.

TieflingGuard5_129.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_129.context: NodeContext: Almost muttered to herself in her annoyance.

TieflingGuard5_18.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_18.text: She's helpless. You could ensure she never stands again.

TieflingGuard5_123.speaker: Narrator
TieflingGuard5_123.text: *The symphony already plays in your head: every toe snapping like a twig.*

TieflingGuard5_68.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_68.text: Where did you get this potion?

TieflingGuard5_137.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_137.text: From the old lady in the cave - the one with the 'lotions and potions'.
TieflingGuard5_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards the cave.NodeContext: Player has asked

TieflingGuard5_105.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_105.text: To her credit, it worked. I'm as strong as a bugbear. And fearless.
TieflingGuard5_105.context: NodeContext: Trying to feign a bit of bravado at her own situation.

TieflingGuard5_58.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_58.text: Course she also warned of side effects. Should have listened. Now I'm stuck guarding crates.
TieflingGuard5_58.context: NodeContext: Thinks this is her own fault. Doesn't suspect any foul play. Almost rolling her eyes at herself at the end as she tries and fails to feign indifference.

TieflingGuard5_133.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_133.text: Hah. Deadly serious. Still - the sooner this wears off, the better.

TieflingGuard5_87.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_87.text: And then some - just hope this wears off soon.

TieflingGuard5_119.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_119.text: Strong brews sometimes have lasting effects. You should prepare for the worst.

TieflingGuard5_126.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_126.text: What?! No, no. She said it wouldn't be permanent. It can't be! It'll wear off soon - it has to.
TieflingGuard5_126.context: NodeContext: Panicked and trying to convince herself.

TieflingGuard5_20.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_20.text: That doesn't sound like a side effect at all. Let me heal you.

TieflingGuard5_117.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_117.text: All right... I guess being fearless won't help if an arrow comes flying right at me.
TieflingGuard5_117.context: NodeContext: sigh before the all right.

TieflingGuard5_59.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_59.text: Hold still and I'll cast the spell.

TieflingGuard5_45.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tries to stand up, but her legs buckle and she fals down immediately.NodeContext: She paid the player to heal her, but the player ran away with her money. She's shouting for the guards to come help her.

TieflingGuard5_38.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_38.text: Sit tight. I'll be back soon.

TieflingGuard5_19.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_19.text: Wait - but... all right. Don't be long.

TieflingGuard5_12.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_12.text: You'll be dead in seconds if the goblins come. I can heal you. For a price.

TieflingGuard5_5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_5.text: All right... I guess being fearless won't help if an arrow comes flying right at me. Here.
TieflingGuard5_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you some money.NodeContext: sigh before the all right.

TieflingGuard5_69.speaker: Wyll
TieflingGuard5_69.text: How generous. Do you charge by the bell, or the spell?

TieflingGuard5_57.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard5_57.text: Forget it. I don't need your money.

TieflingGuard5_145.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5_145.text: Oh, eh, thank you. You'll still heal me, right?

TieflingGuard5_102.speaker: Pandirna
